intro: Gyrostemon oligogynus, commonly known as the slender gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Gyrostemon oligogynus is a low-growing shrub that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native insects and small animals.
